Question: The Space Foundation named this person as a recipient of its 2013 General James E Hill Lifetime Space Achievement Award.
Hints: This person made seven flights in the X-15 from November 1960 to July 1962.
This person's second and last spaceflight was as mission commander of the Apollo 11 moon landing, in July 1969.
Before becoming an astronaut, this person was an officer in the U.S Navy and served in the Korean War.
